title: What is the Relationship Between Sacred and Profane Time in the Quest for Eternity?
first_phrase: This text delves into the concept of the sacred versus the profane, and how the present moment is the metaphysical point where eternity converges. The author draws upon the legend of Shambala, the sacred city of the North, and its association with the "way of the gods." The text establishes that the past serves as a vestibule that leads to the eternal present, where all experience is dissolved in the pupil of God. The text also explores how the aesthetic myth of purification is a fragile bridge constructed by modern imbecility to escape from confronting the positive certainty of mystery.

last_phrase: In a world oscillating between a dead past and an uncertain future, we must embrace traditional wisdom that lives, fertilizes, and actualizes the past, infusing it into the present and renewing it in the eternal truth of the golden age. Let us not cling to an illusory future, for only the present is dynamic and full of potential.
